Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida

It was a full satisfaction for me to receive the very valued letter from Your Excellency dated June 21 recently past, and, by virtue of what it requests, I hereby send by copy the responses given by the Government of the Riograndense Republic and by its Generals David Canabarro and João Antônio da Silveira on the occasion of the invitation made by the Baron of Caxias for the proposal of the bases on which the cessation of the war then sustained against the Empire should be founded. As to the peoples of Japeju and São Tomé, my father-in-law says they belong to the Missions west of Uruguay, and are located on the right bank of this river. I shall esteem that in this way the request of Your Excellency is satisfied.

Your Excellency

Your Excellency

Your Excellency

My son Antônio Pedroso de Albuquerque is the bearer of this; he is going to São Paulo to complete his law degree there, and as it is difficult to meet with Your Excellency

Your Excellency

José Pedroso de Albuquerque.

Alegrete, September 16, 1860  
From Mr. José Pedroso de Albuquerque.  
Received on September 26, 1860.  
Answered on September 26, 1860.
